Subjective: Hard stools; constipation (2-3 days without bowel movement); abdominal pain and cramps; painful defecation; bloating and distended abdomen; underweight. No blood in stool; no changes in appetite or eating habits; no weight loss; no urinary changes; no menstrual irregularities; no family history of similar bowel issues. Request: Concerned if condition is serious; wants help softening stools.
Objective: Abdomen: sensitive lower left quadrant; varying tympani on percussion; dampening on percussion of lower left quadrant. Normal bowel sounds.
Assessment: Suspected irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) with constipation predominance. No signs of alarm symptoms.
Plan: Prescribed psyllium fibre sachets, to be taken daily with plenty of water for 6 weeks.
Follow-up in 6 weeks to evaluate response to treatment.
Safety net: Report worsening abdominal pain, fever, or blood in stool.
Discuss referral to dietitian at next visit for weight management.
